intro: Rhodocodon rotundus var. campanulatus, commonly known as the bell-shaped rhodocodon, is a flowering plant characterized by its unique, bell-shaped blooms. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
